---
name: "DBC Research Ticket Template Kit - 02: Define research approach"
about: To guide the creation of a high-level approach to an upcoming research study. 
labels: "disability-benenfits,research" 
assignees: ''

---

> [!NOTE] 
> If you have any recommended changes to this ticket template, contact a DBC designer. Otherwise, remove this notice when creating your ticket.

### Description
The output of this ticket will outline the high-level approach to the upcoming [study name] study. The study focuses on [brief description of study].

The research approach is not intended to be a detailed research plan; the detailed plan will be created next, after the research approach has been approved.
- The goal is to identify key research questions and devise an approach to answering these questions, and to get stakeholder approval of the approach
- Output: a defined research scope and approach

The form of the research approach definition should be appropriate to the project, timeframe, and stakeholder preferences. For example:
- A conversation between researchers and stakeholders
- A Mural
- A more formal document

#### Timeframe for this ticket
This ticket should take well under a single sprint.

#### Output
[Add link when it’s ready. Note status (in progress/final)]

### Tasks
**Outline research goals**	
- [ ] Align with HCD lead, UX enabling partner, and Product Manager on the high-level purpose and scope of the research
- [ ] Review product brief, super-epic, or other relevant docs to understand background context
- [ ] Draft big picture research goals, questions, or hypotheses

**Review existing research**	
- [ ] Review your team’s previous research on this product, if available
- [ ] Review Research Repo for relevant research from other teams
- [ ] Summarize findings from research review (can be informal, e.g. in a Mural)

**Decide on a research method**
- [ ] Choose a research approach will enable you to answer your main questions or test your hypotheses (e.g. moderated/unmoderated; interview/card sort/survey/usability test/shadowing; unstructured/scenario based, etc.)
- [ ] Decide what type of prototype or other testing material is needed (e.g. content only, flat wireframes, interactive wireframes, coded prototype, or staging prototype)
- [ ] Outline the type and number of participants you want

**Create a timeline**
- [ ] Map out a high-level timeline of the research project from start to finish
   - [ ] The timeline can be text-based or visual (e.g. in Mural)
- [ ] Account for holidays, time off, and other ongoing work

**Get feedback on the approach**
- [ ] Get feedback from the HCD lead, UX enablement partner, and Product Manager
- [ ] Incorporate feedback

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] High-level scope of research is agreed upon by UX enabling partner and Product Manager
- [ ] Subsequent tickets are created
